title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 343.4 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 343.4 - Definitions

State Regulations

Unless otherwise defined in this Part, the definitions in the

Mental Hygiene Law and those contained in other parts of this Title shall
apply. If there is a conflict between definitions contained in this Part with
those in other regulations, the word or phrase defined in this Part shall
control. (a) Alcohol awareness program
means a program approved by the division which meets the learning objectives
established by the division to provide a positive educational experience to
youth who have gotten into trouble with the law as a result of
alcohol. (b) Applicant means an
entity which applies to the division to become a certified provider of an
alcohol awareness program for youth. (c) Certified provider means an entity which
has applied for and has received the approval of the division to establish and
provide an alcohol awareness program for youth. (d) Director means the Director of the

Division of Alcoholism and Alcohol Abuse. (e) Division means the Division of Alcoholism
and Alcohol Abuse. (f) Prevention
education program for youth means a series of activities designed to assist a
youth to recognize and eliminate his or her use of alcohol and/or other mind
altering substances. (g) Program
means the alcohol awareness program for youth. Notes

343.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
